intro: Berkheya, commonly known as the "spearthorn" or "giant dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their upright, often spiny stems and large, lobed leaves. The flowers are typically yellow and arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Berkheya species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Some species are cultivated for their ornamental value or used in traditional medicine.
